HomePage.title: The Kiwi Specialists since 1986
HomePage.subtitle: A family-run agricultural business from Veneto
HomePage.businessDescription: We are a family with a deep bond to our land, which we have nurtured and farmed for at least six generations. Since 1986, kiwis have been our main crop and our pride

selfPicking.title: Self-picking
selfPicking.description: Come and pick your kiwis directly from the tree!
selfPicking.description2:
Service available every day from October 25 onwards from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM.

Children are welcome!

We recommend comfortable clothing and shoes or boots.

farmersMarket.title: Our outlet
farmersMarket.description: Come visit us at our outlet to discover all our products!
farmersMarket.description2: Our outlet is always open and is located at Via Restello 19, Villa del Conte (PD) (<gmaps>Google maps</gmaps>)

Faq.q3: How to ripen kiwis in 4-7 days?
Faq.q4: How to ripen kiwis in 7-10 days?
Faq.a4: Store the kiwis at room temperature.
Faq.a3: Place kiwis in a tightly sealed paper bag with fruits that emit ethylene, such as apples, pears, or bananas.

a2.1: Kiwis can last from a few weeks to several months, depending on the precautions taken. The precautions are:
a2.2: Periodically separate the fruits that ripen more quickly.
a2.3: Store the fruits in a crate, in a dark, dry, and cool place, away from other fruits that release ethylene, like apples, pears, or bananas (alternatively, in the refrigerator).
a2.4: It is possible to wash, peel, and freeze them to preserve them for up to 10 months. In this case, they will be more suitable for smoothies, juices, jams, ice creams, or cakes.

Faq.a1: We ship throughout Europe via DHL. Delivery times vary depending on the destination, with an average of 3-5 business days.
